Award.AwardTitle: Group Travel Award: Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research 2010 International Polar Year Open Science Conference
Award.AbstractNarration: This award supports the U.S. participation in the Fourth Open Science Conference to be held in Buenos Aires, Argentina, in August 2010, during the XXXI Meeting of the Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research (SCAR; www.scar.org). The main conference's theme is "Antarctic Witness to the Past, Guide to the Future", and this is an international and interdisciplinary meeting that brings together students and polar investigators of all ages from around the world with interests in Antarctic science and research. The conference is an excellent opportunity to view and discuss the most recent research results as papers on all aspects of polar studies will be presented. The provided funds will allow approximately 25 U.S. young faculty, researchers, postdoctoral appointees, and students to attend one of the most important international polar science conferences. During the meeting, the attendees will have the unique opportunity to hear the latest research results, network with international colleagues with similar interests, and nurture and enhance existing partnerships. Attendees will meet scientists from other countries and form new partnerships and collaborations that would not have otherwise occurred. In particular, applicants from under-represented groups, young scientists, and students will be encouraged to attend the conference enhancing their careers by meeting and collaborating with international colleagues. The broader impact will be facilitation of U.S. scientists' participation in international Antarctic science opportunities such as the SCAR scientific research programs. Following the formal conclusion of the International Polar Year (IPY 2007-2008) in March 2009, most of the ongoing and future Antarctic research efforts are now focused on formulating a framework for securing the legacy of this significant international event.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Project funds were used to support US participation in the fourth  Scientific Committee on Antrctic Research (SCAR) Open Science Conference. The Conference was held in Buenos Aires, Argentina in August, 2010. The Conference theme was "Antarctic Witness to the Past, Guide to the Future". The funds provided partial travel support for 45 US participants to attend the Conference. Preference  was given to applicants from under-represented groups, young scientists, and students; to those presenting oral and/or posters at the Conference; and those actively involved in research related to the Conference theme.

 The fourth biennial SCAR Open Science Conference was held in Buenos Aires, Argentina from 3 to 6 August, 2010. The Open Science Conference is an international and interdisciplinary meeting that brings together students and investigators of all ages from around the world with interests in Antarctic and Southern Ocean science and research. The symposium was an excellent opportunity to view and discuss the most recent polar research. Papers on all aspects of azntarctic research were presented.

 These funds allowed 45 US faculty, researchers, postdoctoral appointees and students to attend one of the most important international polar science conferences. During the meeting the attendees had the opportunity to hear the latest research results, network with international colleagues with similar interests, and nurture and enhance existing partnerships. Attendees met scientists from more than 35 countries and formed new partnerships and collaborations that would not have otherwise occurred. In particular, applicants from under represented groups, young scientists, and students were encouraged to attend the symposium to enhance their careers by meeting and collaborating with international colleagues. The broader impact is  facilitation of US scientists’ participation in international Antarctic science opportunities such as SCAR's scientific research programs.
